values:
Well I gained 2 lbs over the course of 3 days. I had a few cheats here and there which I'm sure effected it.

So yesterday I did what the diet calls a steak day. I didn't eat all day long and then for dinner I had a huge steak. I drank water all day long, about a gallon's worth.

But I only lost .2 l s this morning. So I'll see how today goes and where I end up in the morning.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So altogether I lost 21.4lbs. I thought I might have screwed everything up yesterday because I was bad. I had pizza. And a small bag of sun chips. Jacob didn't help either. Cause I say, pizza sounds good and he volunteered with I can pick one up. After 24 days I didn't have anymore will power. So I was bad. But that's all I ate all day. I didn't allow myself to have anything else.

Today starts day one of the stabilization phase. I'm thinking tuna salad for lunch. Not sure about dinner yet. Will have to figure that out later.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I've been busy. Food wise nothing exciting has happened. But yesterday I did meet my second goal. I've lost 20lbs. Actually as of this morning I lost 21.4lbs. Today is my last day before I start my stabilization phase. I need to do some research to see what kind of foods I can have.

I know I'm allowed 1500 calories a day. And I'm still not allowed starches or sugars. But if I can find a list of YES foods that would be great.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Only .4 away from meeting my next goal. I honestly was starting to think I wasn't going to make it. And yesterday EVERYTHING sounded good. I'm kind of looking forward to the stabilization phase, I can make things like muffins, and dessert. I have a huge sweet tooth and right now fruit isn't doing it for me. I'm a little said because my weightloss average isn't 1 - 2 lbs a day. I'm under that. But at the same time I'm still happy and proud with all that I have accomplished so far.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Lunch was the meatballs and marinara and an apple. Dinner cottage cheese. Nothing else. I've done horrible with the drops today. I forgot to take them on lunch. I didn't remember until 3:30. And I started eating dinner before I remembered so I had to stop and wait for 15 minutes and then go back to eating. Hopefully that doesn't screw me up too much.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Took me two days but i'm back to 189.2 lbs again. I was very frustrated and hurt. And I didn't really share with many people that I had gained. I kinda felt that it was Karma. I've been telling everyone how good I was doing. I'm guessing I shouldn't have done that.

On a brighter note. Yesterday I got to fit into a pair of scrub pants and a scrub top that I haven't been able to wear in over a year. So for that I'm grateful. I've made some positive changes. I have 3 days left to go on this phase of the diet. Then I move on to the stabilization phase. And then it's up to me to maintain the weight through the holidays.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Life sometimes keeps me from getting on here. Yesterday was hard because I was upset. But thankfully this morning I went down to 189.6 lbs. That helped me feel better. I've stuck to the diet. I've been tempted especially today because a receptionist from another office brought in a moonpie from a specialty shop and I wanted a bite, but I resisted.

Dinner tonight was GREAT! Since Jacob's mom came over I made spaghetti, and Jacob was kind enough to help by making out homemade marinara so I could eat that. And I made homemade meatballs which were DELICIOUS! Everyone else had store bought meatballs. And they had cheese bread.

No fruit for me today. And my grain was in the meatballs.

Hoping tomorrow will be a good scale morning.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

This morning I gained .8 lbs. That's the most I've gained. It's hard, now I'm back into tue 190s. I was SOOOOOOO excited to be out of it. And a day later I'm right back there. I know going up from time to time is normal, especially even though I don't get periods, now would be the time I'd have one, so maybe that's part of it. It's still a little discouraging. But I'm going to try not to let it get me down. I'm going to press on and hope tomorrow morning shows a better result.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Today was good. Lunch was cottage cheese, a piece of sesame melba toast, and an apple. I also walked a half mile on lunch. I know that's nothing big, but I need to start some cardio in here somewhere.

Dinner was a piece of cod, my first time having it, I'm personally not real impressed. Was lacking in flavor. Oh well, it was bought and needs to be eaten. Jacob picked it up to try since it'd been so long since he had fish. And he wasn't a fan. So that leaves it up to me. I also had 3 slices of red pepper with my fish. And the strawberry sorbet with a piece if Melba toast.

After measuring myself today I'm down 10.3 inches! Woohoo!

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I'm so happy I could cry. I hit my goal. I weighed myself and I'm 189.2! To hit my next goal I just need to lose .8lbs and then I'll be down 20 lbs! I am shocked and very proud of myself. I have stuck to this diet, and I haven't cheated (other than a small bite of candy my boss force fed me and the tiniest sip of a frozen coffee). I've stayed dedicated even though I have to make ALL my meals (except cottage cheese), which isn't the most convenient... But I've done it! I know this is all just a start I still have so much more to lose, I'd like to be down to at least 160 by next October. I'd prefer 150, but I'm ok with 160 and my flabby arms being toned.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Lunch: chicken I pan fried with garlic salt, italian seasoning, and some lemon juice. With a strawberry sorbet-ish, that I ate part of on a piece of Melba toast.

Dinner: I decided to try crab, only it wasn't until after I ate it that I realized it was imitation. So, let's hope I didn't screw myself up too badly by doing that. I had a piece of Melba toast and an orange.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Down .4 this morning. I figured it'd be more since I didn't eat very much yesterday, but my body is weird. That's ok though, still going in a positive direction.

Jacob and I are going to go walking this morning. He asked if I'd be interested in going with him, and I said of course.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I've not eaten much today. Came home from soccer ate my cottage cheese real fast. Took an apple with me but never ate it. Spent 6 hours shopping. Came home was going to just skip dinner and Jacob made me a burger. So I ate that, and didn't really feel like anything else, so I just had that.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So I am now only 2 lbs from my goal. I'm very excited. I think I might actually achieve it! I don't think I've ever actually met a weightless goal that I've set for myself. So I'm looking forward to this one. The next one I have after getting under 190 is to lose 20 lbs which I only have another 3.4 pounds to go until I accomplish that. So I could potentially achieve both of these. :0)

Today will be a little difficult. I have a soccer game at 11 for my daughter. And then I have a shopping date with my future mother in law at 2. So I'm probably just going to have cottage cheese for lunch and take it with me. And maybe and apple, because it's easy to eat in the car.

Last night I was VERY proud of myself. I stopped and got Jacob some Mcdonalds on the way home (yes he's completely done with the protocol) and I didn't cheat. Not even a little bit. :0)

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Day 16 went well. Lunch was cottage cheese, an apple, and a piece of sesame Melba toast. And dinner was tilapia and an orange.

Nothing to exciting.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

This morning I'm only down .2lbs. I'm ok with this because I'm still making progress. I'm working in a positive direction. Clothes are starting to fit better, I can wear a belt I haven't been able to since I bought it, and I'm hoping on my next cycle (which won't be until January) to lose a pants size.

2.8 lbs to go until my goal!

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Lunch of course the same chicken I had for dinner yesterday. With an orange.

Dinner: I made tilapia. I haven't eaten it in forever since Jacob doesn't like fish, but he was willing to try. I cut six slices of a lemon and lauds it on the bottom of my pan, seasoned the fish with garlic salt, pepper, and some garlic & herb seasoning I have. Then I laid the fish on the lemon slices and then squeezed some lemon juice on top. I covered the pan with tin foil and baked it at 350 for 40 minutes. It was delicious. (to me, Jacob tried a bite but didn't really like it)

I then made an crustless apple pie for our fruit. It was pretty tasty. And very easy. Sliced apples (1 per person) in a pan tossed with a little lemon juice and cinnamon, then the crumbly topping is a piece of melba toast (per serving), nutmeg, cinnamon, a dash of allspice, and a dash of ginger mixed with a T of milk. That's sprinkled over the top, cover and bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Then uncover and put in the broiler for 2 minutes to crisp the topping. YUMMY!

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Day 14:

Lunch: the steak we had the night before, homemade applesauce, and a sesame Melba toast.

Dinner: chicken baked with our homemade marinara sauce. My new strawberry creation and 2 sesame Melba snacks.

And as of this morning I'm down another 1.2 lbs, which puts me at 15.4 lost! Only 3 more pounds until my goal!!

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So I'm now 14.2 lbs lighter. I lost another .6 this morning. 5.8 lbs more and I will reach my goal. I feel good. My double chin is starting to go away, clothes are starting to fit better, I like all these things. It's just more fuel to help me keep going.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Lunch: cottage cheese, sesame Melba toast, and an orange. I skipped my veggie nothing sounded good.

Dinner: Jacob made pan cooked steak. I again didn't want a vegetable, so I skipped it, I had 2 sesame Melba snacks, and for fruit I put my strawberries in the blender with some truvia. Then let it sit in the freezer to firm up while I ate my steak. They were pretty tasty. Definitely will have to try that again.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So, I'm down another .6 lbs. Yay! I know Jacob is getting very frustrated with the restricted eating. And I understand that. It sucks having basically the same 2 foods everyday. But, for me the sacrifice is worth the result.

Although since the majority of my weight came off the first week, I'm thinking the next time I try this, I'll go do the diet with the drops for a week, and then do the 21 day stabilization period. So that way, the diet is done within a month. And I can take 6 weeks off, and then do it again. Just a thought... But we'll see.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I just got done measuring myself, and I'm down 8.7 inches! Yay!

Lunch today was the same as dinner from last night. Accompanied by an orange and a piece of sesame Melba toast.

Dinner was not a hit with Jacob or I. It was a white chicken chili. But neither one of us were a fan.


There was just too much clove in it for either of us. We each took two bites and decided on cottage cheese. For fruit I had the other half of my strawberry sorbet. And Jacob had an apple.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

This morning I lost 1lb. So that puts me at 13 pounds lost. And only 5.4 lbs away from my goal.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Today wasn't bad.

Lunch we had 3.5 oz of light cottage cheese. Vegetables didn't sound good so we skipped them. Jacob had an apple and I had an orange.

Dinner, Jacob made hamburgers.

We wrapped them in lettuce.
Jacob had strawberries with truvia, and I made a strawberry sorbet.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

This morning I got on the scale and I lost another .4 lbs. Which puts me at 12 lbs lost total.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Only down .2, but that's a good thing. Still going down. I've got 10 days left before my maintaining phase. I hope to lose the 7lbs I want to.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I'm sorry I didn't post last night or this morning. I just got busy and didn't get a chance to do it.

Day 8:

Dinner we made breaded chicken. We ground up 2 Melba toast (1 for each of us) and dipped small chicken cutlets into 2 tbs of milk (1 tbs for each) and then rolled them in the breading. The breading was also seasoned with salt and pepper and garlic salt.


We each had 3 pieces. With one piece we cut it up and rolled it in a lettuce leaf. And then just ate the last 2 pieces with a knife and fork.

Jacob also made us a glass of lemonade. I know it involved juice of a lemon and some truvia to sweeten. It was yummy!


And we each had an apple for our fruit.


Day 9:

I'm down another .4 today. I've slowed down. But atleast I'm still decreasing, so I'm taking it as a good thing.


For lunch I ha the exact same thing I had for dinner yesterday. And for dinner we had Jacob's ground beef and broccoli concoction. With 2 sesame melba toast and an orange.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

This morning according to the scale I'm down .6lbs. Which puts me at 11 lbs lost!

Although Jacob is kicking my butt, as of yesterday he's down 14 lbs!! I'm not letting that discourage me. It's easier for men to lose weight (which I feel is HIGHLY unfair!). I'm going to keep going and I hope that I reach my goal of 190! 7 more pounds to go!

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Jacob made dinner for us tonight. He cooked broccoli and ground beef together. He seasoned it. It was pretty tasty. I definitely wouldn't mind that again. That was accompanied with a piece of Melba toast and strawberries.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Down another .4 this morning. I think I might have over did it on my fruit last night, so I'll try to be more careful.

For lunch I'm planning on last night's chicken, an orange, and 1 sesame Melba toast.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Dinner was DELICIOUS. We made a homemade marinara and then poured it in with chicken breast and then baked it. It was tender and delicious and I'm excited to make it again.

Our fruit was sliced strawberries with truvia.

Chicken with the marinara sauce.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So I stepped on the scale and I'm down to 198.4, that's 10 lbs less then when I started! This is awesome for me! Really makes me want to stick with this. And once it's over (after the holidays) I will pursue another cycle.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I might have gained .2 lbs but I've lost 4.3 inches! Yay! That makes me feel accomplished! And that is helping me push forward, that and my amazing (future) sister-in-law.

Lunch today was what I had for dinner yesterday, with applesauce and sesame Melba toast.

Dinner, Jacob made pan fried steak (no oil) with a onion soup seasoning on it. We both had an orange as fruit and 2 sesame Melba snacks.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

This morning I gained .2 lbs not sure how that happened. But I'm going to try and not let it discourage me. Let's hope tomorrow morning is better.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Lunch today wasn't the greatest, we were suppose to have meatloaf, but it didnt turn out very well.

I was going to have cucumbers with my lunch, but it had frozen in the refridgerator. So I fried up some garlic and onions to eat with my meat instead. And we had strawberries with truvia for our fruit. And I had a piece of Melba toast for my grain.

Dinner was chicken pizziala (sp?) just chicken baked with seasoned tomatoes. And Jacob and I aren't really big tomato people so after they were cooked we tossed them in the blender and made them into a kind of salsa. I had another piece of Melba toast with it. And for fruit I had some of my homemade applesauce.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So today I'm down another pound. Actually now I'm under 200. UNDER!! I haven't seen this weight in almost 2 years. I'm excited. I'm ready to keep moving forward!

I'm so appreciative for my best friend (and future sister in law) and her husband for telling me about this diet.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So today went well. I didn't find myself starving before my meals.

Lunch: garlic chicken
Cucumber slices
7 strawberries
2 sesame Melba snacks

Dinner: 5 meatballs (homemade)
With a homemade marinara sauce
And homemade applesauce

All the foods were good. It's almost surprising how many things taste good without sugar! (or added fats like oil or butter)

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I'm down another 2.6 lbs. Yay! This makes me feel good. Hopefully I can get down to 190 this cycle. That's my goal. And then I need to maintain that through the holidays. And depending on my results I'll do another cycle in January.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

So far so good. Lunch was good. I had the taco wraps I had for dinner. And an apple and 2 of the sesame Melba snacks.

I'm looking forward to dinner. Jacob's making a version of blackened chicken with red peppers.

And I'll probably have that with a piece of Melba toast. And half an orange. (I know the other half of the orange Jacob uses while making the chicken).

I was down 2 lbs from yesterday this morning when I weighed myself. (you're supposed to lose an average of 1-2 lbs a day)

We'll see how things are tomorrow.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Well I survived. Lunch was ok, dinner was delicious, I just wish I could have had more. Not eating until lunch time tomorrow is going to be rough. Especially since breakfast is my favorite meal, and breakfast foods are my favorite.

Lunch today was:
Albacore white tuna (in the pouch)
Slices of cucumber
A tango apple (I recently found if at the grocery store OMG delicious!!)
2 Melba snacks (the sesame kind)

Dinner:
Lettuce wrapped tacos (well as close as I could get to tacos, no toppings or sauces)
1 Melba toast
1/2 grapefruit with truvia to sweeten


So like I said day 1 down... Let's see how things are in the morning when I weigh myself. I started this morning at 205.8

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Well, it's been a VERY long time since I've posted on here. I figured since I have just started a very difficult diet, this would be my place to write about it. :0)


I'm doing the HCG diet. I'm doing the drops not the injections. And I today was my first day of phase 2. (Phase 1 was only 2 days. Those were the "loading days")

Now I'm on 500 calories a day for the next 25 days. No breakfast. Lunch and dinner. Snacks if needed. But that takes away from your lunch or dinner.

It will be hard. But since I have gained about 70 lbs since HS (so 10 years) I know I need to get rid of this weight. I don't find myself attractive. I don't know how Jacob does, but I am grateful for that. He's amazing and I'm lucky to have him.

So this is where my journey starts. Let's see how I do.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Your Relationship is Strong
You've built the foundation of a great relationship, and it would take a lot to shake it. Through good communication and respect, you have a true love that can last a lifetime.
How Strong Is Your Relationship?

You Are More Yin
Feminine Devoted Forgiving Fall Winter Afternoon Moon Time Passive Metal Honey
Are You More Yin or Yang?

Really this is for my fellow cooks...

I tried a new recipe this morning for Peanut Butter Pancakes. I thought they would be interesting. And after making them, I realized they're missing something, but I can't quite figure out what. 

Recipe:

2 cups all purpose flour
2TBSP Sugar
1/4 tsp salt

Combine these in a large mixing bowl


In a smaller bowl combine:

3/4 cup of peanut butter (creamy)
2 eggs slightly beaten

after these are combined slowly add in 

2 cups of milk



After the peanut butter mixed is well mixed add it to the dry mixture. Combine until slightly lumpy. It may be a little runny at first, but it will stiffen up after sitting for a few minutes. 


Heat a lightly greased pan. 

Make pancakes as normal. This should make about 16 pancakes, unless you make them the size I do, then it's like 9. :o)



They're really not light and fluffy. They're very heavy. And VERY filling. Generally I can eat 3 or 4 pancakes. I had 1 and already felt full. But they leave something to be desired. I just can't figure what else I could put in there. 

They do say to add peanuts, but I don't like crunchy pancakes, so I opted to leave them out.

Ok since it's 7 in the morning, no one else is up, so I can't call anyone and tell them how happy I am, so I'll have to put it here.

It may not be exciting to you, but it is to me. I've been trying to get Eric to get pictures done with Kayli and I since about a year ago, and he's always said no. And I emailed him the other day with the idea of us getting family pictures done for Christmas since alot of people on my side of the family have yet to see him, cause they all live out of state. Also because I want family pictures. And I said that could be my Christmas present, since I really want them, and he said it sounded like a good idea!!! I'm so excited!!!!!

*dances*

I can't wait!

Ok, I'm done now, I just wanted to share.
